intro: Lepadena bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lepadena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive two-toned leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. Lepadena bicolor is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
